section.title: Overview
section.para: The Diagnostics tab lists all the tests that can be performed on the network.

section.title: Running tests and viewing their results
section.para: Tests can be run automatically or manually.
The following tests run automatically at session startup:

listitem.para: DSL Profile Validation (results in Accounts Activity tab)
Quality of Service (full results in Accounts Activity tab)
Line State Diagnosis (full results in Account Activity tab, a summary in DSL Service Information window)
Subscriber information (full results in Account Activity tab, a summary in Subscriber Information window).

section.para:
The action and the tests below are available in the Diagnostics tab:
Escalation (Action)
Line Quality Diagnosis - Automatic Mode (LQD)
Line Quality Diagnosis - Forced Mode (LQD)
Line Quality Validation (LQV)
Line State Diagnosis
SELT Diagnosis

The action and the tests below are available in the Diagnostics tab:
Bandwidth Report
Link Diagnostics
Validate PON Quality
Power Validation
Link Quality History

para.emphasis: Before you launch a manual test, it is important to be aware of the nature of the test: some of them can take more than one day to complete and cannot run with the subscriber's call just on hold. For SELT, LQV and LQD, the results are not available immediately.

listitem.para: SELT will take 40 seconds to four minutes to complete. On successful start, the console will show the inspection Id in the Account Activity tab. If the port does not support SELT, an exception will be listed. To get the SELT results, you need to run the SELT again after SELT completion. The property called NACCSR.SELT.InspectionStopTimeWithIn in Environment Properties which will be used to check whether the system needs to start a new SELT inspection or retrieve the results for a previously run SELT.

Note that SELT (Single-Ended Line Testing) is not supposed to run when the line is up, and running it in such condition will result in a fail. For more information, please see NA-C R8.0 User Guide, 13.1, SELT Overview.

LQV will take about a day to complete. On successful start, the console will show the inspectionId in the Account Activity tab. After the LQV diagnosis has completed, you must log in and run the LQV again to get the results. The property called NACCSR.LQV.InspectionStopTimeWithIn in Environment Properties will be used to check whether the system needs to start a new LQV inspection or retrieve the results for a previously run LQV.

LQD takes between 3 minutes and one day (monitoring duration given as input) to complete. On successful start of the inspection it shows the inspectionId. After the LQD diagnostics has completed, you must log in and run the LQD again to get the results. The property called NACCSR.LQD.InspectionStopTimeWithIn in Environment Properties will be used to check whether the system needs to start a new LQD inspection or retrieve the results for a previously run LQD.

step.para: In the left area, select the appropriate test.
Confirm the test run by clicking Run in the dialog box.
Some tests require that you provide additional information, such as a free-text label to identify the test. Fill in such fields when requested, and validate to launch the test.

When the test is over, it appears in the right area of the Diagnostics tab, in the list titled Tests and Actions Run. Clicking a test in this list opens the Account Activity tab, selects the test and displays its full results.
